headline.main: DEATH OF R.L. STEVENSON; Apoplexy Carries Away the Master of Modern English Fiction. BURIED ON PAA MOUNTAIN SUMMIT Inspiring Career of a Writer in Whose Work Was Charmingly Reflected, the Mind of a Great Artist.

snippet: LONDON, Dec. 17 -- A dispatch to The Star, dated Apia, Samoa, Dec. 8, confirms the report that Robert Louis Stevenson, the novelist, died suddenly a few days ago from apoplexy. His body was buried on the summit of Paa Mountain, 1,300 feet high.
